channel.title: Making a GIF faster
channel.description:
![](upload://yOOxZSdPo31FQoMZGuQTxD3Wtva.png)
I used photoshop to create and animate this, the delay between frames is set to 0.0, but why the fuck is it so slow?
I want this to be lightning quick. What should I do? I've tried shrinking it and fiddling with the options photoshop gives you to no avail.

item.title: Making a GIF faster
item.dc:creator: poptartfrommars
item.description:
Fellow Scientist:

How is it not relevant? The OP was having problems with his animation frames playing at the wrong speed. I suggested he learn about Frames Per Second. He thought that was the same as Delay Between Frames. I informed him it was not. Others made the same mistake, and I explained further why they were wrong. And here we are. How is that not related to the OP? It’s a discussion on frames, speed, animation - exactly what the OP was about.

I love how his thing says banned

Read full topic

item.title: Making a GIF faster
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Mine is not static, it gets reset by my download manager every time a new rapidshare link starts downloading, but I would still use a proxy simply by old habit, it’s like a reflex.

And no, nobody’s dumb enough to use a proxy all the time nonstop, I just push a button to enable/disable, and I can change proxies if it’s too slow or unresponsive.

item.title: Making a GIF faster
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
Fellow Scientist:

Derp. 10 frames per second is 10 frames per second, or 10 still images displayed per second. 0.1s between say 3 frames is not 10fps - it’s 3 frames with 0.1s between them. A delay between frames does not equal how many frames are present. Yes, if you had a 0.1s delay between frames, you’d only get 10 frames per second max - but it does not mean there are 10 frames. It means each frame has a 0.1s delay between them, and that’s about it. There’s much more to it as well, but let’s not over-strain your comprehension “skills” all at once.

Man, are you fuckin retarded? I can drive my truck at 100 km/h (I shouldn’t have to explain that it’s 100 kilometers for every one hour of driving since your comprehension skills are so developed) but that doesn’t mean that I have to drive a minimum of 100 km. I can drive 2 km, but I’m still going 100 km/h. 3 frames with a 0.1 second delay between all of them is still 10 FPS, no matter how you slice it there buddy.

EDIT: sorry, just had to let that out. I raged as soon as I read that post. I see he’s been banned now. oh well

Read full topic

haha! I cant tell ya how many times that has happened to me.

So is the gif perfect yet? Do I read this right that different browsers really do cache it and display it in different speeds? I am stupid enough to never have known that would happen. I thought internet speed was internet speed no matter how you browsed it.

item.title: Making a GIF faster
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
Fellow Scientist:

No, they’re two frames with a 0.1 second pause in between them. The next two frames could have a 0.0 pause, or a 1.0 second pause between them, making your fps “calculations” rather wrong rather quickly. That’s why there’s this thing called frames per second, and why it’s different to delay between frames.

go away.

Read full topic
